item.title: 南加州蓬勃发展的新太空枢纽
item.description: 嗨，我是旧金山的 Paayal Zaveri 和 Ed Ludlow。我们最近来到南加州，目睹了一个蓬勃发展的太空制造中心，其部分动力来自 SpaceX。但首先 ...【原文：Hi, It’s Paayal Zaveri and Ed Ludlow in San Francisco. We recently traveled down to Southern California to bear witness to a flourishing space manufacturing hub, ignited in part by SpaceX. But first …】

item.title: 美国食品和药物管理局（FDA）暂停生产流感疫苗后，诺瓦维克斯股价大跌
item.description: 在一名临床试验参与者发生严重不良事件后，美国监管机构暂停了 Novavax 公司试验性流感疫苗的开发，之后该公司股价下跌了 20%。【原文：Novavax Inc. shares fell 20% after US regulators placed a hold on the development of its experimental flu vaccines following a severe adverse event that occurred in a single clinical trial participant.】

item.title: 伊朗哈格岛出口终端附近发生石油泄漏
item.description: 据半官方的塔斯尼姆通讯社（Tasnim news agency）援引当地一位航运官员的话报道，伊朗在距离其位于波斯湾的最大出口码头哈格岛（Kharg Island）仅几英里处发生了石油泄漏。【原文：Iran suffered an oil leak just a few miles from Kharg Island, its top export terminal in the Persian Gulf, according to the semi-official Tasnim news agency, citing a local shipping official.】

item.title: ASML 首席执行官认为芯片的缓慢复苏将 "持续到 2025 年
item.description: ASML Holding NV 首席执行官克里斯托夫-福凯（Christophe Fouquet）表示，第三季度财报令人失望，引发了整个半导体行业的大范围抛售，他预计芯片市场的缓慢复苏将 "延续到 2025 年"。【原文：ASML Holding NV Chief Executive Officer Christophe Fouquet said he expects a slow chip market recovery to extend “well into 2025,” following disappointing third-quarter earnings that sparked a broad selloff across the semiconductor industry.】

item.title: 路特尼克称，特朗普执政后，苹果和特斯拉将缴纳更高的美国税收
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普过渡团队联合主席霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）表示，在特朗普第二届政府执政期间，苹果公司等企业将在美国缴纳更多的税款。【原文：Howard Lutnick, the co-chair of Donald Trump’s transition team, said firms like Apple Inc. will pay more tax in the US under a second Trump administration.】

item.title: 比特币逼近 70,000 美元，投机者觊觎历史新高
item.description: 随着对风险资产的乐观情绪升温以及美国大选迫在眉睫，比特币多头再次将目光投向 3 月份创下的历史高点。【原文：Bitcoin bulls are setting their sights again on the record highs reached in March with optimism building around riskier assets and the looming US elections.】

item.title: 习近平敦促官员努力实现第四季度增长目标
item.description: 中国国家主席习近平呼吁政府官员在最后一个季度尽一切努力帮助中国实现5%左右的年度增长目标，这凸显了随着年底的临近，世界第二大经济体所面临的压力。【原文：Chinese President Xi Jinping called on government officials to make every effort in the final quarter to help the country meet its annual growth target of around 5%, underscoring the pressure the world’s No. 2 economy is facing as the year end draws closer.】

item.title: 墨西哥谢因鲍姆将审查能源领域的公私合作伙伴关系
item.description: 墨西哥总统克劳迪娅-谢因鲍姆（Claudia Sheinbaum）寻求消除给予与公共实体合作经营的私营能源公司的不公平优势，尽管她指望私人资本来实现其雄心勃勃的可再生能源目标。【原文：President Claudia Sheinbaum seeks to remove unfair advantages given to private energy companies operating in partnership with public entities in Mexico, although she counts on private capital to achieve her ambitious renewable energy goals, according to a top government official.】

item.title: 光子计算初创公司 Lightmatter 估值达 44 亿美元
item.description:
投资者向该公司投入了 4 亿美元，旨在加快构建新的人工智能软件的速度。【原文：

Investors put $400 million into the company, which aims to make it faster to build new AI software.

】

item.title: 亚马逊在电子阅读器历史上首次为 Kindle 添加颜色
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）正在推出一套焕然一新的 Kindles，其中包括该公司 17 年前开始生产电子阅读器以来第一款能够显示颜色的机型。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. is rolling out a refreshed set of Kindles, including the first model capable of displaying colors since the company began making the e-reader 17 years ago.】

item.title: 肯-格里芬，亚马逊投资新一代核能
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）和亿万富翁金融家肯-格里芬（Ken Griffin）是投资小型核反应堆的支持者之一，该技术正在蓬勃发展，被誉为原子能的下一个时代。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. and billionaire financier Ken Griffin are among the backers anchoring a $500 million investment in small nuclear reactors, a burgeoning technology that has been heralded as the next era for atomic energy.】

item.title: 英国汽车协会主席表示，英国年轻司机应面临更严格的规定
item.description: 英国汽车协会（AA）汽车故障服务首席执行官表示，应禁止刚通过考试的英国年轻司机搭载年龄相仿的乘客，并应悬挂特殊车牌。【原文：Young British drivers who have just passed their test should be banned from carrying passengers of a similar age and should display special plates, according to the chief executive officer of the AA car breakdown service.】

item.title: 桑坦德银行转向 "轻资本 "模式，卸载更多风险
item.description: 桑坦德银行（Banco Santander SA）希望将更多风险转嫁给私人投资者，以释放资本。【原文：Banco Santander SA wants to offload more risk to private investors as it seeks to free up capital.】

item.title: 据说华平正在考虑收购德国 IT 公司 Nagarro
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，华平投资集团（Warburg Pincus）正在考虑收购德国 IT 服务公司 Nagarro SE。【原文：Warburg Pincus is weighing a possible buyout of German IT services company Nagarro SE, people familiar with the matter said, potentially adding to the strong momentum of dealmaking in the country.】

item.title: 南澳橄榄球队推迟对 Springboks 私人股权交易的投票
item.description: 负责监管卫冕世界冠军 Springboks 队的南澳橄榄球协会表示，该协会推迟了其成员工会就向总部位于西雅图的 Ackerley Sports Group LLC 出售一家新成立的商业版权公司 20% 股份的投票。【原文：SA Rugby, which oversees the reigning world champion Springboks team, said it postponed a vote by its members unions on the sale of a 20% stake in a newly created commercial rights company to Seattle-based Ackerley Sports Group LLC.】

item.title: Northvolt 裁员开始显现，400 名员工被解雇
item.description: 陷入困境的瑞典电池制造商 Northvolt AB 已在其位于 Skelleftea 的运营中心裁员近 400 名白领，这是与瑞典两个工会结束谈判的一部分。【原文：Troubled Swedish battery maker Northvolt AB has laid off nearly 400 white-collar workers at its center of operations in Skelleftea as part of concluded negotiations with two of the Swedish trade unions.】

item.title: 贝莱德与安巴尼洽谈印度私人信贷业务
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，全球最大的资产管理公司贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：BlackRock Inc., the world’s largest asset manager, is in talks with billionaire Mukesh Ambani’s Jio Financial Services Ltd. to set up a private credit venture, aiming to tap the expanding direct lending opportunities in India, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 摩根大通在肯尼亚和象牙海岸开设办事处，拓展非洲业务
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co.）在肯尼亚和象牙海岸开设了代表处，以帮助这家美国银行拓展东非和西非市场。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. opened representative offices in Kenya and Ivory Coast to help the US bank expand in east and west Africa.】

item.title: 价值 230 亿美元的养老金投票为乌拉圭大选蒙上阴影
item.description: 在拉丁美洲的富人天堂，乌拉圭人即将决定是否对其社会保障体系进行全面改革，这项耗资 230 亿美元的提案颇具争议，为即将举行的总统选举蒙上了阴影。【原文：In Latin America’s haven for the rich, Uruguayans are about to decide whether to overhaul their social security system in a controversial $23 billion proposal that’s overshadowing the upcoming presidential election.】

item.title: 加拿大首次启动土著投资交易商活动
item.description: Cedar Leaf Capital 是加拿大首家土著人拥有的投资交易商，在获得监管机构批准后，计划于本月晚些时候正式启动。【原文：Cedar Leaf Capital, Canada’s first Indigenous-owned investment dealer, is planning an official launch later this month after winning approval from regulators.】

item.title: Airbnb 推出合作房东市场，促进房源供应
item.description: Airbnb Inc.在其应用程序和网站上推出了一个新栏目，房主可以在此聘请房东管理他们的出租房，这凸显了该公司为增加房源和吸引更多的人使用该平台而做出的更广泛的努力。【原文：Airbnb Inc. launched a new section of its app and website where homeowners can hire fellow hosts to manage their rentals, underscoring a broader push to increase listings and attract more people to the platform.】

item.title: 三井物产支持的 ETG 向莫桑比克索赔 1.2 亿美元
item.description: 三井物产株式会社（Mitsui & Co.）是莫桑比克最大的股东之一，这家农产品贸易商 ETG 开始对莫桑比克提起仲裁，要求莫桑比克赔偿 1.2 亿多美元，并称莫桑比克在没收其资产方面扮演了重要角色。【原文：ETG, an agricultural-commodity trader that counts Mitsui & Co. among its biggest shareholders, began arbitration proceedings against Mozambique, claiming more than $120 million for what it says is the state’s role in expropriating its assets.】

item.title: 新加坡立法者修改法案阻止安联保险交易
item.description: 新加坡立法者通过了一项法案修正案，将有效阻止安联集团（Allianz SE）以 22 亿新元（17 亿美元）收购一家本地保险公司多数股权的提议。【原文：Singapore lawmakers passed an amendment to a bill that will effectively block Allianz SE’s proposed S$2.2 billion ($1.7 billion) acquisition of a majority stake in a local insurance firm.】

item.title: 顶级预测师认为石油时代即将终结
item.description:
国际能源机构描绘了一幅原油生产商的暗淡图景，因为需求已接近饱和，"电力时代 "即将到来。【原文：

The International Energy Agency paints a bleak picture for crude producers as demand nears a plateau and the ‘Age of Electricity’ dawns.

】

item.title: 法国极右翼向巴尼耶发出警告，划出预算红线
item.description: 法国极右翼国民自发组织列出了一份明年的财政愿望清单，其中包括对超级股息和股票回购征税。【原文：France’s far-right National Rally outlined a fiscal wish list for next year that includes taxing superdividends and share buybacks, keeping up pressure on Prime Min】

item.title: 路威酩轩集团在中国的衰落震惊了奢侈品投资者
item.description: 18 个月前，LVMH 集团股价创下历史新高，集团控股股东 Bernard Arnault 成为全球最富有的人。【原文：Eighteen months ago, LVMH shares were trading at a record high and the group’s controlling shareholder, Bernard Arnault, was the world’s wealthiest person.】

item.title: 银行和私人贷款人为出售 Anaqua 准备 8 亿美元一揽子方案
item.description: 据知情人士透露，银行和直接贷款机构正竞相提供总额约为 8 亿美元的一揽子债务，以支持对专利软件公司 Anaqua 的潜在收购。【原文：Banks and direct lenders are competing to provide a total debt package of around $800 million to back a potential buyout of patent software company Anaqua, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 波兰出售 30 亿欧元债券后将专注于 2025 年的资金需求
item.description: 波兰财政部债务主管表示，在 30 亿欧元（33 亿美元）债券销售 "基本完成 "其 2024 年借贷计划后，波兰政府的目标是专注于明年的融资需求。【原文：Poland’s government aims to focus on next year’s financing needs after a €3 billion ($3.3 billion) bond sale “practically completed” its borrowing plan for 2024, according to the Finance Ministry’s debt chief.】

item.title: 意大利将比特币资本利得税从 26% 提高到 42
item.description: 意大利计划将比特币的资本利得税从 26% 提高到 42%，这是在削减财政赤字的同时为昂贵的竞选承诺提供资金的努力之一。【原文：Italy plans to raise the capital gains tax on Bitcoin to 42% from 26%, part of efforts to finance expensive election promises while cutting the fiscal deficit.】

item.title: ASML 意外财报预示部分芯片制造商前途未卜
item.description: ASML 的意外业绩对整个芯片行业都有影响。但首先...【原文：ASML’s surprise results have implications for the overall chip industry. But first...】
